intro: Monarda virginalis, commonly known as white bee balm, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its showy, tubular white to pale pink flowers. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are aromatic when crushed, emitting a minty scent. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, often found in moist woodlands and meadows. Monarda virginalis is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
